SerializationError

name: src/Error/SerializerError.js
SerializerError
description: Root error for the serializer.

name: src/Error/UnimplementedMethodError.js
src/Serializer/AbstractSerializer.js
AbstractSerializer
description:
Base class that can be used for writing a custom serializer. It is especially convenient if your serializer do only
serialization or only deserialization. If not, it you are better off implementing SerializerAwareInterface or
SerializerInterface.

name: src/Serializer/Serializer.js
Serializer
description:
Default serializer.

Meant to aggregate all the application serializers and be used as the main serializer in the application. This means
that for serializing a new object, a custom serializer for this one should be done and registered to this serializer.

params.name: format
params.description: Format the normalization result will be encoded as

params.name: format
params.description: Format the given data was extracted from

name: src/Serializer/SerializerAware.js
SerializerAware
description: Any serializer implementing this interface will access to a serializer at runtime.

name: src/Serializer/SerializerInterface.js
SerializerInterface
description:
A serializer is responsible for transforming a data in a specific format into a data in another format.

For example, the serializer can be used to map client-side models and back-end side objects by checking all the
properties of a model to generate an object for which the values are understandable for the back-end service.

+--------+ ----- serialize -----> +----------+
| Client |                        | Back-End |
+--------+ <---- deserialize ---- +----------+

Note that JavaScript does not support interfaces per se. By "Interface" is meant that this class should not implement
any method but provide the skeleton for child classes instead.

name: serialize
description: Serializes any data object into and object usable for the backend service.

params.name: format
params.description: Format the normalization result will be encoded as

name: supportsSerialize
description: Checks whether the given class is supported for serialization by this serializer.

params.name: format
params.description: Format the normalization result will be encoded as

name: deserialize
description: Deserializes data back into an object of the given class.

params.name: format
params.description: Format the given data was extracted from

name: supportsDeserialize
description: Checks whether the given class is supported for deserialization by this serializer.

params.name: format
params.description: Format the given data was extracted from
